1349.45.text:
You have to have the
soil conditions right,

1351.62.text:
you've got to have a low
pH, between 4.8 and 5.2 pH.

1357.99.text:
- It's hard to get,
you've got to usually add

1361.39.text: to get the pH low enough.

1364.46.text:
at planting you need
to add two or three

1367.03.text:
good shovel-fulls of a good
sphagnum Canadian peat-moss

1372.94.text:
to get the organic matter
good in that planting hole.

1376.21.text:
So whoever planted
that blueberry plant

1378.58.text:
did all that and they
got that going good.

1380.88.text:
But blueberry plants, if
they're the rabbit-eye types

1383.52.text: that we recommend in this area,

1388.49.text:
- If you let 'em, if
you don't prune 'em.

1389.92.text:
And so you're talking
about digging this plant up

1391.62.text: and putting it in a container

1393.46.text:
that you're putting
potting soil in there

1396.20.text:
and is the potting soil
gonna be the right pH?

1398.26.text:
Is it gonna have the right
amount of organic matter?

1401.63.text:
If he wants one
in that container

1403.14.text:
I would suggest that he go
buy a small blueberry plant

1406.17.text: and plant it in the container,

1407.77.text:
but leave that one
established alone,

1409.78.text: leave it there if you can.

1412.48.text:
that you're gonna
build onto the house

1415.21.text:
or, you know, that you need
that area for something else.

1418.38.text: I don't recommend trying to move

1421.99.text: Now if you have blueberry plants

1424.46.text:
that you planted two
or three years ago

1426.79.text:
and you didn't do all those
things that I suggested you do,

1429.76.text:
if they're still alive,
they're just sittin' there

1433.00.text:
- [Chris] Okay, so
then you could do that.

1434.53.text:
- So dig those up
and put 'em in a pot,

1437.60.text:
but make sure the pH is
right and all that is right.

1442.44.text: I always tell folks to leave it.

1444.98.text:
- Because my concern,
one of my concerns

1446.25.text: is if you're gonna dig it up,

1447.51.text:
you're not gonna get all
the root system anyway.

1450.75.text:
- The root system
on most plants,

1453.29.text:
including trees, go
out about 1 1/2 times

1458.06.text:
So that means if
that blueberry plant

1466.77.text: out from the base of that plant,

1468.63.text:
it may be further, cause
they're gonna go in the topsoil

1471.67.text:
and you're talking about
how large is the container?

1475.77.text:
- [Chris] Two feet wide, 18
inches deep, not big enough.

1482.05.text:
All right Matt, so
I hope that helps.

1484.78.text:
- Hope that helps, but we
saved the blueberry plant,

1488.49.text:
- Yeah, but we

1490.09.text:

- All right, Mr.
D, thanks a lot.
